text: Kim Hee-chul during Singderella press conference in 2016 Kim Hee-chul (born July 10, 1983) is a South Korean singer-songwriter, actor and television personality. He is also a member of the South Korean K-pop boyband Super Junior. He made his acting debut as Baek Jin-woo in the second season of Sharp (2005), a teen drama. He has since acted in leading roles in Rainbow Romance (20052006) and Flower Grandpa Investigation Unit (2014); and in supporting roles in Bad Family (2006), Golden Bride (20072008), and Loving You a Thousand Times (20092010). He made his silver screen debut by starring in the film Attack on the Pin-Up Boys (2007) and voiced Simon Seville in the South Korean version of Alvin and the Chipmunks (2007). He also starred as Sonny Malone in the South Korean remake of the musical Xanadu (2008). He started his career as a host on the weekly music show Show! Music Tank in 2005. He was a recurrent host of Inkigayo between 2005 and 2006, before becoming a regular host from 2007 until 2008. He has appeared as special host for a few episodes ever since. He was the host of the talk show Radio Star between 2010 and 2011, for which he won the Best Newcomer Award at the 11th MBC Entertainment Awards. He became a radio DJ through the radio programs Young Street Radio (20052006), and later Kim Heechul's Youngstreet (20102011). He enlisted in the military in 2011 as a public service worker and hosted the Seongdong District's web radio program Space for a Rest – Visible Radio (20122013) as part of his service. In 2015, he was cast in the variety show Knowing Bros alongside Kang Ho-dong and Min Kyung-hoon. His role in the show earned him his first Baeksang Arts Awards nomination at 56th ceremony in the Best Male Variety Performer category. He also won the Best Entertainer Award and Best Couple Award with Min at the 5th JTBC Awards for his role in the show. The duo has since released the singles "Sweet Dream" (2016) and "Falling Blossoms" (2018) through the variety show, which earned them the Best Rock Song awards at the 9th and 10th Melon Music Awards, respectively. He has been a regular cast member on the reality shows Delicious Rendezvous and My Little Old Boy since 2019, for both of which he received the Excellence Award at the 13th SBS Entertainment Awards. He has acted in several music videos including in TraxX's "Let You Go" and Sistar's "Shady Girl", both of which were released in 2010. Kim made his directorial debut in 2011 with the music video for M&D;'s "Close Ur Mouth". He later directed the music videos for "I Wish" (2015), "Narcissus" (2016) and "Ulsanbawi" (2016); and screenwrote "Falling Blossoms" (2018), "Old Movie" (2019) and "White Winter" (2019). == Films == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Film performances |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"|Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"|Year ! scope="col" colspan="4"|Credited as ! scope="col" rowspan="2"|Artist(s) ! scope="col" class="unsortable" rowspan="2"|Description ! scope="col" class="unsortable" rowspan="2"| |- ! scope="col" | ! scope="col" | ! scope="col" | ! scope="col" | |- !scope="row"| "Flying Girl" | 2007 | | | | | Magolpy |style="text-align:left;"|The video shows a girl, plays by Kim Hyang- gi, who is watching street performers, including Kim Hee-chul who acts as a puppeteer. Park Yoo-chun, Kangin, Shindong, Joon Park, Kim Jang-hoon and Eru also appears as other street performers. They later join the girl as accompanists in her performance. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Let You Go" | 2010 | | | | | TraxX |style="text-align:left;"|Kim Hee-chul and f(x)'s Victoria starred in the music video as a couple who are going through their daily lives after experiencing a break-up. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "King Wang Zzang" | 2010 | | | | | Defconn feat. Kim Hee-chul |style="text-align:left;"|It combines footage from the recording studio and concert events, interspersed with clips of Defconn riding a motorcycle. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Shady Girl" | 2010 | | | | | Sistar |style="text-align:left;"|The music video is a parody of an avatar blind date, and Kim Hee-chul acts as the avatar of comedian Kim Kyung-jin. At the end of the video, Kim Hee-chul rebels against Kim Kyung-jin and refuses to be his avatar any longer. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Close Ur Mouth" |2011 | | | | | M&D; |style="text-align:left;"|The video incorporates the long take filming technique, in which Kim walks down corridors but he kept being interrupted by other people. A large number of guests such as Simon D, Miss A's Jia, F.T. Island's Lee Hong-gi and Choi Jong- hoon, Beast's Yong Jun-hyung, and comedian Kim Kyung-jin appeared in the music video. |style="text-align:center;"| * * |- !scope="row"| "Breakups are So Like Me" |2011 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul with Kim Jang-hoon |style="text- align:left;"|The music video showcases clips of Kim Hee-chul and Kim Jang-hoon at the recording studio and them singing against a white wall. The song and its music video were released on the day before Kim Hee-chul enlisted in the military. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Open The Door" | 2013 | | | | | Im Chang-jung |style="text-align:left;"|The music video portrays Im with a special power that makes people become repentant of their wrong doings when he stares at them. It includes cameo appearance of various artists, including Kim who dances with Im in front of the Korea National Assembly Proceeding Hall. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "You Are A Miracle" | 2013 | | | | | Various Artists |style="text-align:left;"|It shows footage of various artists during recording of the song. The collaboration song is a friendship project for 2013 SBS Gayo Daejeon and has 125 participating singers, including Kim. All proceeds from the song and its music video is donated through SBS's charity channel. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Shall We Dance With Dr. Lim" | 2014 | | | | | Im Chang-jung feat. LE, Epaksa |style="text-align:left;"|The music video's concept is to encourage people to smile and promote peacemaking. It includes cameo appearance of many artists including Kim, who takes part in Im entertaining antics and infectious dance. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "I Wish" | 2015 | | | | | M&D; |style="text-align:left;"|The music video features Kim as a selfish boyfriend, and frequently abandon his girlfriend, plays by GFriend's Yerin, on their dates to be with his other friends. He eventually straighten up and celebrates their relationship anniversary by giving her a couple ring and a kiss. |style="text-align:center;"| |- |- !scope="row"| "Narcissus" | 2016 | | | | | M&D; |style="text-align:left;"|Kim does not appear in the music video but his vocals are still heard. The music video was filmed from a first person perspective and presented with the idea of having a relationship with Kim Jin-kyung. It changes to a third person perspective halfway through the video and showcases that they have broken up, with her showing sadness as she visits their old dating spots. |style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Ulsanbawi" | 2016 | | | | | Kim Heechul & Kim Jungmo |style="text-align:left;"|The music video features Kim Hee-chul as a fan of DIA's member Jung Chae-yeon. He is happy when he is able to meet her at a fansign event and she eventually watches his busking performance with his friends. It was later revealed that it is just a dream and Jung remains a celebrity that he can only see in his television screen. |style="text- align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Sweet Dream" | 2016 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul with Min Kyung-hoon |style="text-align:left;"|The music video portrays Kim as a high school student who has a crush on Momo Hirai but she only has eyes for his best friend, who is played by Min. It is revealed at the end of the video that Min had been harboring feelings for Kim instead. The music video has managed to present LGBT to viewers in a lighthearted manner. |style="text- align:center;"| * * * |- !scope="row"| "Melody" | 2016 | | | | | Eve feat. Kim Hee-chul |style="text-align:left;"|Kim does not appear in the music video, but his vocals are still heard. Eve are shown performing in a warehouse while a man, potrayed by SS501's Kim Kyu-jong, and a woman are trying to turn off voices in their head. |style="text-align:center;"| |- !scope="row"| "Charm of Life" | 2017 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul with Shindong, Eunhyuk, Solar |style="text-align:left;"|The music video has Kim cosplays as the rapper Nucksal, Shindong as Killagramz, and Eunhyuk as Namolla Family's Go Jang-hwan. Nucksal and Killagramz appeared in the music video as well, showing the similarities between their looks. Solar only appears in television screens in the video. |style="text-align:center;"| * * |- !scope="row"| "Falling Blossoms" | 2018 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul with Min Kyung-hoon |style="text- align:left;"|Min acts as the head of the family in lieu of his father and mentally retarded older brother, portrayed by Kim, but runs into trouble with gang members while trying to help his mother (Park Mi-sun) and brother. The gang beats Kim up in front of his teacher (Fromis 9's Roh Ji-sun) to get to Min. Min carries out revenge but it only ends up with Kim dying in the process. |style="text-align:center;"| * * * * |- !scope="row"| "Old Movie" | 2019 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul |style="text-align:left;"|Kim and Park Yoo-na portray a couple who had just broken up, and the contrast between their way of handling it. When Kim tries to win Park back at the end of the video, she appears to had already moved on. |style="text-align:center;"| * * |- !scope="row"| "White Winter" | 2019 | | | | | Kim Hee-chul with Lee Soo-geun |style="text-align:left;"|Kim and Lee Soo-geun act as new artists with the stage name Woojoo Jjokkomi, who meet their seniors Itzy at a dress rehearsal of a music program. The duo managed to impress Itzy with their performance, and receive standing ovation from the group. The music video also includes a cameo by Shindong, who plays a television director. |style="text- align:center;"| * * |} == See also == * Super Junior filmography * Super Junior videography == Notes == == References == Category:Kim Hee-chul Kim Hee- chul
title: List of Kim Hee-chul performances
